column5: Headed down to the big lake today for some salmon, but it seems the trout were out to play, well caught 3 trout, one shaker salmon.  We were obviously having a better day than this guy         I had the first fish on, a decent trout, but we lost it at the net (damned net boy)  Paul was up next and got a 29 incher but we didn't take a picture, then I was up and got one about the same, 28 inches.         This is our next boat        Boy, did it send some big waves our way tho         This guy was entertaining the masses at the marina.      This was our take home for the day.      When we got back to the marina, a Ministry of Natural Resources guy came over and asked how we did and if we kept any.  We told him our catch and he wanted to see the salmon.  He said they were taking stock and wanted samples of scales and to see if it was a natural fish, which it was.  He said that they figured the natural ones were going to be about 25% but were pleasantly surprised that they were coming in at 45%  Anyhow, nice day to be on the water, a bit of a breeze to keep us cool, which unfortunately lead to my nasty sunburn as it didn't feel like I was getting too much sun.  Not complaining tho  Joey
Great day on the water Joey! Trout for supper? Nothing like getting rocked by a multi million dollar wave, eh?

Sorry I miss you Joey as we were in the area as well. I can see the Ministry has taken samples from your Chinook too  Didn't see the pipe guy but got to see Bob Izumi going in Too bad for the sunk boat  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Geez, too bad we missed seeing each other Emil, how did you make out?
That boat is massive! Some beauty fish
no salmon, say it isn't so....LOL  looks like that boat made a tidal wave  but a good day on the water
Way to go, Joey!!  Couple nice bows and a good "eater" salmon...nice pics, looks like you are enjoying that new camera!

Nice catch!! Which 'Big Lake' was that out of? I have yet to catch a trout or salmon and really really really wanna get one before this year's done!! Don't even know how to go after them to be honest but you seem to know what you're doin Beautiful fish!  Great shot of that little fishin boat in front of that floating city btw! Haha
Thanks.  That would be Lake Ontario!
what a waste of money ....that big boat didnt have one downrigger on it that i could see...
Way to go Joey,Nice fishies  I dont think that the floating city needs any riggers,Hes fishing for bikini bottoms
Good for you both!    Those are some beautiful fish
well you know what they say ..."NO RIGGERS >>>>NO RODS" guys with big boats like that are making up for short commings in other areas...lol....  i dont seem a bit jealous do i ???
LOL, Paul was figuring out where we could mount them as it went by    Thanks everyone, I'm sure bushed from all that sunshine!!
The riggers or the bikinis???? seems to me there was lots of room for the riggers...but hardly any room for the bikinis...lol..
Nice trout.  That is a big yacht indeed.  Nice daay to be out on the water.
Fun stuff Joey, good to hear you guys enjoyed your day.  Looks like you've got your boat rigged up really nice now for downrigging.
Great report Joey. Glad you guys got out. So it's salmon gweeches for lunch today?
Mmmmm, been a long time since the kids and I had fresh trout.  Looks like you and Paul will have a few meals there.
nice fish...  i really like the wake of that big boat!
sweet work there Joey and Paul awesome!!
Good job!
